qas.question: The missile started being used more often instead of what weapon?
Small missiles were designed that could be mounted on what?
When did these missiles start to supplant gun-based SPAAG systems?
What are man-portable missiles better known as?

context: As this process continued, the missile found itself being used for more and more of the roles formerly filled by <a0_0>guns<a0_0/>. First to go were the large weapons, replaced by equally large missile systems of much higher performance. Smaller missiles soon followed, eventually becoming small enough to be mounted on <a1_0>armored cars and tank chassis<a1_0/>. These started replacing, or at least supplanting, similar gun-based SPAAG systems <a2_0>in the 1960s<a2_0/>, and by the 1990s had replaced almost all such systems in modern armies. Man-portable missiles, <a3_0>MANPADs<a3_0/> as they are known today, were introduced in <a4_0>the 1960s<a4_0/> and have supplanted or even replaced even the smallest guns in most advanced armies.
